meanings.definition: Showing different colors when viewed from different angles.
meanings.sent1: The dichroic gemstone sparkled with various hues as I turned it in the light.
meanings.sent2: The dichroic glass pendant changed from blue to green depending on how you looked at it.
meanings.sent3: The chameleon claimed the dichroic title, changing its color to blend in with every background.
meanings.sent4: Her mood was as dichroic as the sunset, shifting from joy to sadness in an instant.
meanings.sent5: The dichroic effect of the soap bubbles made them look like tiny rainbows floating in the air.

meanings.definition: A material that reflects or transmits light in two different colors.
meanings.sent1: The artist used dichroic in her mosaic to create a stunning play of colors.
meanings.sent2: The dichroic in the stained glass window made the sunlight split into two distinct hues.
meanings.sent3: The magician's cloak seemed to be made of dichroic, as it glowed red on one side and blue on the other.
meanings.sent4: The lake at sunset appeared as a dichroic mirror, reflecting the orange and pink sky above.
meanings.sent5: The dichroic of the crystal ball revealed a future filled with both light and darkness.
